title: Wednesday 4AM SGT — Crypto Rebounds as Dollar Weakness Accelerates, CPI Day Arrives
commentary: Crypto staged a solid bounce with ETH surging +5.46% to $2,015 and BTC rallying +2.78% to $68,994, reversing this week's risk-off bleed as digital assets finally catch a bid ahead of today's CPI print. Dollar index slipped further to 96.80 after weak December retail sales sealed the deal on a more dovish Fed — markets now pricing three rate cuts in 2026 versus two a week ago, with China's Treasury warning adding fuel to the fire. Precious metals remained under pressure with silver extending its brutal correction (-2.56% to $81.23), now down over $40 from its late-January $121 peak, while gold held near $5,028 (-0.62%) defending the psychological floor. Equities treading water into CPI — S&P 500 flat at 6,963, Dow edging to fresh records — as the inflation print will either validate or demolish the rate cut narrative.

title: Wednesday 3AM SGT — Silver Extends Correction to -2.2%, Markets Drift Pre-CPI
commentary: Silver's brutal correction deepened to -2.18% at $80.44, now down over $40 from its January $121 peak as the speculative unwind continues ahead of today's CPI print — gold followed suit at -0.84% to $5,037, slipping toward the $5K psychological floor. US equities treading water with S&P 500 -0.19%, Dow -0.02%, and Nasdaq -0.30% as traders refuse to commit before inflation data drops. VIX crept up +2.25% to 17.75, the highest reading this week, signaling mounting nervousness but no panic. Nikkei continues outperforming at +2.28%, riding yen weakness as the JPY index rose +0.90% — Japan's export-heavy stocks still catching a bid while the rest of Asia consolidates.

title: Wednesday 2AM SGT — ETH Tanks -4.3%, Silver Slides as Pre-CPI Risk-Off Intensifies
commentary: Ethereum led the risk-off exodus, dumping -4.27% to $2,036 — its worst session this week — while BTC held relatively better at -1.30% ($69,764), signaling crypto bears are targeting altcoins into today's CPI print. Silver's brutal correction extended to -2.67% at $81.14, now down nearly 33% from its late-January $121 peak as the speculative frenzy unwinds. Gold eased -0.66% to $5,026 but held above the psychological $5K floor as China's central bank extends its 15-month gold buying streak. DXY flat at 96.84 after last week's -2% slide, with markets pricing three Fed cuts in 2026 after December retail sales stalled and China warned institutions to trim US Treasury holdings — dollar bears still in control but taking a breather.

title: Wednesday 1AM SGT — Silver's Slide Deepens, ETH Tanks -3.4% as CPI Looms
commentary: Silver's correction accelerated to -2.52% at $80.16, shedding nearly $4 from this week's highs as precious metals profit-taking intensifies ahead of today's CPI print — gold followed lower at -0.63% to $5,047. Ethereum took the biggest hit of the night, dumping -3.37% to $2,023 while BTC held relatively better at -0.97% ($69,317), with crypto now firmly in risk-off mode as inflation data anxiety grips markets. US equities barely moved — Dow +0.57% to 50,420, S&P 500 flat at 6,969, Nasdaq -0.09% — as traders refused to commit ahead of the CPI catalyst. Nikkei extended its rally (+2.28% to 57,650) bucking the cautious global tone, while VIX crept up +0.46% to 17.44 signaling nervousness without panic.

title: Wednesday Midnight SGT — Silver Gives Back Parabolic Gains, Crypto Slides Ahead of CPI
commentary: Silver's explosive rally hit a wall — the white metal dropped -1.87% to $80.69, retracing a chunk of its +8% parabolic move earlier this week as profit-taking accelerated before Wednesday's CPI print. Gold followed suit, slipping -0.84% to $5,037 as precious metals cooled from their dollar-weakness-fueled highs. US equities tread water with Dow +0.41% at 50,343, S&P 500 +0.20%, and Nasdaq +0.14% as markets await the inflation data that could reshape rate expectations. Crypto continues bleeding with ETH down -2.08% to $2,020 and BTC -0.64% at $69,109 — digital assets still unable to catch a bid as the pre-CPI risk-off trade dominates. VIX flat at 17.38, suggesting traders are cautious but not panicking into the data release.

title: Tuesday 11PM SGT — Dow Extends Above 50K as Retail Weakness Surfaces, Crypto Bleeds
commentary: Dow pushed higher to 50,460 (+0.65%) led by AmEx and Disney as consumer discretionary caught a bid, while Nasdaq slipped -0.15% as megacap tech took a breather after Monday's run. Retail sales data showed holiday-season weakness as tariff uncertainty reshuffled American buying habits — macro concerns meeting market resilience. Silver gave back more of its meteoric gains (-0.30% at $82) with gold flat at $5,080, while crypto continued bleeding with BTC -1.39% to $68,316 and ETH -1.69% to $2,008 — digital assets still decoupled and drifting lower ahead of Wednesday's CPI print. VIX crept up +1.38% to 17.60 as volatility inches back before the inflation data drop.

title: Tuesday 10PM SGT — Precious Metals Give Back Morning Gains, Nikkei Surges +2.3%
commentary: Precious metals retreated from their explosive morning highs — silver now down -0.72% at $81.64 after earlier touching +8.75%, gold slipping -0.13% to $5,073 as profit-taking hit the dollar weakness trade. US equities held gains with Nasdaq +0.90%, S&P 500 +0.47%, and Dow flat at 50,136 (+0.04%) above the 50K milestone, while VIX edged up to 17.64 but remains subdued. Nikkei was the day's standout, surging +2.28% to 57,650 as yen weakness (+1.4% JPY Index) fueled export-heavy stocks. Crypto continues drifting sideways with BTC at $68,974 (+0.56%) and ETH $2,021 flat, still decoupled from equities as markets await Wednesday's CPI print.

title: Tuesday 5AM SGT — Silver Rips +8.75% in Parabolic Move, Gold Holds $5,100 as Dollar Weakness Intensifies
commentary: Silver extends its explosive rally to +8.75% at $83.62, its best session in weeks, as precious metals continue to feast on persistent dollar weakness — gold firm at $5,104 (+2.5%) with dip-buyers aggressively defending the $5K psychological floor. US equities consolidated Monday's gains with S&P 500 +0.48%, Nasdaq +0.91%, and Dow flat at 50,144 (+0.06%) above the 50K milestone, while VIX eased to 17.36 (-2.3%) keeping volatility contained ahead of key CPI data this week. Oil edged higher to $64.23 (+1.1%) as US-Iran Hormuz tensions simmer with ships warned to avoid Iranian waters. Crypto flat-lining with BTC unchanged at $70,741 and ETH +1.1% at $2,126 — digital assets still decoupled from the precious metals frenzy as inflation hedges dominate the narrative.

title: Tuesday 4AM SGT — Metals Consolidate Near Highs, Crypto Finds Footing
commentary: Precious metals pausing for breath after their explosive run — silver steady at $82.50 (+7.3%) and gold holding firm at $5,078 (+1.9%) as the dollar weakness narrative plays out in thin overnight trade. US equities closed Monday with modest gains, S&P 500 +0.54% and Nasdaq +0.97%, consolidating near Friday's relief rally highs as VIX remains subdued at 17.15. BTC finding support at $70,892 (-0.7%) after testing lower, with ETH stable at $2,129 (+0.2%) — crypto stabilizing but still failing to catch the precious metals bid. All eyes on CPI print later this week as inflation hedges continue to outperform.

title: Tuesday 3AM SGT — Silver Pauses at +7.5%, Precious Metals Consolidate Near Highs
commentary: Precious metals catch their breath after an explosive run — silver holding at $82.68 (+7.52%) and gold firm at $5,082 (+2.05%) as the dollar weakness trade consolidates. US equities drifted higher overnight with S&P 500 +0.54% and Nasdaq +0.97%, while Dow barely budged (+0.02%) just above the 50K milestone. Oil edged up 1.4% on US-Iran Hormuz tensions. Crypto continues underperforming risk assets with BTC down 1.2% at $70,248 as the inflation data and delayed January jobs report loom this week.
